intro: Harrisonia occidentalis, commonly known as the western harrisonia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and vines. The plant is characterized by its small, white to yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite and oval-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Harrisonia occidentalis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
